column4: Last night my update manager found several Kernel updates, so I downloaded them and rebooted my system.  After that, my wireless card can't be found.  I am using an Atheros card, and it appears that other people are having this same problem.  Google has been finding a lot of people having this same problem, but no solutions.
Is there a quick fix to this problem?
my guess is that you installed a module for the kernel, new kernel means reinstalling the module
So are you saying that the module I installed is the problem... is it easy to revert back to the module I was using?

what I mean is that everytime you install a new kernel you need to tell reinstall the module. i believe the new kernel is in fact the same version as the old one so you can't really go back to the old one
just reinstall the module
I am not sure how to do that.  My update manager did everything for me, it found some updates so I downloaded them and rebooted.
i reckon you will have to do that again. i don't have an atheros card so google will know more about that than i

I'm not even sure to know what to Google.  But basically I would need to reinstall the module that the kernel uses for my wifi card.  How do I know what module I had? I can't really go back and time and use lsmod.
lspci and find out the exact name/model for your wifi card. then google that
Alright, I'll see if I can find out what the exact name and model is
I think this should work.  I am re-installing the madwifi driver, which is compatible with my Atheros card.  Hopes this works.
madwifi rings a bell. i believe that's exactly what you need
I compiled and installed it before, I needed it to extend some capabilities of my card so I could put it in monitor mode, otherwise I couldn't.
Well, I am going to restart my computer
thanks.
good luck :)
It works!
yay
atheros released the specs of their wifi cards so hopefully there will be a free driver soon
that means, no need to work black magic on the terminal
A lot of other people had this same problem with Atheros when they upgraded the Kernel.  I'm going to go on those forums and share the knowledge that you passed to me.
way to go. the community will thank you
